text: you know a lot of us especially
non-asians walk into Asian food stores
and smell things see things we're not
entirely sure what's going on there's
one ingredient that can really bring a
super flavor to your stir fries and that
is fermented black beans a bag like this
costs a buck they look like little
raisins and we're gonna show you how to
cook with them in just a second this is
a shrimp and bok choy stir-fry with
black beans of course we're gonna sort
of marinate the shrimp not really
marinate it but just toss it with a
little of dark sesame oil the Asian
stuff which you'll find in the same
place we find black beans good soy sauce
some slivered garlic and a a little bit
of sugar that all gets tossed together
and if you want you can do this half an
hour an hour before you start cooking
the shrimp should be peeled and a couple
things about shrimp one wild shrimp are
better than farm-raised shrimp two big
shrimp are easier to peel than little
shrimp so you've got the shrimp tossed
with the sesame oil soy sauce sugar the
pan is obviously hot it's smoking I like
to use peanut oil for stir Fry's get
that going and go the shrimp just let
the shrimp sit there for a minute let
them get pink give them a quick stir
another minute we'll get them out of
there you definitely do not want to have
them fully cooked here because we're
gonna bring them back into the pan so if
some are still grayish not fully pink
don't worry about it okay a little more
oil some ginger this time our bok choy
a pinch of salt so we've been going for
maybe three four minutes tops I'm just
looking for the first piece or two to
start browning the greens are wilted
we're going to leave the stems kind of
crunchy a little bit of white wine and
your sherry you can use stock and while
that's reducing a bit we're gonna talk
about our black beans they're salted and
dried and fermented so you need to
reconstitute them a little bit but a
tablespoon is about on what you use in a
dish like this and you're just soaking
them for the time it takes to prepare
the rest of the dish they're ready to go
now they're very powerful
we're ready to put our shrimp back in
the wine has reduced a bit the bok choy
is tender or as tender as we want it to
be we lament the lack of high heat here
but we make do home cooks must make do
looks good though the black beans they
have a very distinct smell which is
quite beguiling I think and it's arising
now a little more sugar that's optional
nice looking sauce though if you're a
fan of thick sauces you can put a little
slurry of cornstarch and water in here
and thicken it up I don't particularly
go that way some chopped scallions the
scallions go in at the very end all you
want to do is get them hot you don't
want to cook them you don't want them to
wilt we are done I give you shrimp with
bok choy and black bean sauce
this is really a stir-fry with some guts
and the black beans add a tremendous
amount and make it taste different than
any stir-fry you make without them it's
really good
